image.altText: Dozens of dark-coloured, medium-sized whales lying on a beach.

props.synopsis: A group of more than 150 whales have stranded near Arthur River in Tasmania, with marine conservation experts responding.

title.children: 'They're all struggling': More than 150 whales stranded in Tasmania's north-west

image.altText: Person displays something in their hand.

props.synopsis: Something has washed up on a Tasmanian beach over the weekend. The Bob Brown Foundation has sounded alarm bells but the salmon farming company it is targeting is reassuring locals there is nothing to worry about.

title.children: Salmon producer orders tests after 'chunks' wash up on Tasmanian beach

image.altText: Anna Reynolds standing in her backyard.

props.synopsis: A group of councillors is calling for the local government minister to "take action", after an adverse finding against the lord mayor by the state's ombudsman.

title.children: Rifts in Hobart council widen after lord mayor slammed by ombudsman

image.altText: GFX 5 Tasmania North West fires

props.synopsis: The bushfires on Tasmania's west coast have now burned nearly 95,000 hectares in hard-to-access terrain.

title.children: Five maps to help you visualise Tasmania's massive wilderness fires

image.altText: Police tape around a house damaged by fire.

props.synopsis: A woman and child have died and another two people are in a critical condition following a house fire in Sydney's west overnight.

title.children: Woman and child dead after 'horrific' house fire in Sydney's west

image.altText: Jim Chalmers holds his arms out while speaking at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers was quick to speak after the Reserve Bank cut rates. As welcome as the news might have been, he knew he couldn't be seen smiling.Â

title.children: It was the rate cut he wanted but Jim Chalmers knew not to smile

image.altText: A group of men in suits sit at a huge wooden table in an ornate room with flowers, documents and water glasses on it

props.synopsis: The US Secretary of State met with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov in Riyadh on Tuesday but Ukraine has said it will not accept a deal it is not party to.Â

title.children: Marco Rubio says Russia 'serious' about ending Ukraine war

props.synopsis: A Victorian woman is suing Uber in the Federal Court, alleging drivers breached disability discrimination laws by repeatedly refusing to pick up her guide dog.

title.children: 'I'm not a second-class citizen': Woman sues Uber over guide dog refusals

image.altText: A woman wearing a tan shirt holding a female child and an infant baby

props.synopsis: The wife and children of an Israeli hostage released a fortnight ago were killed during bombardment of Gaza.

title.children: Hamas to release remains of two young children and mother

image.altText: A man standing in front of a blue painting smiles gently

props.synopsis: What happened? Future historians might puzzle over this seismic shift in sentiment at the top of Australia's foremost public arts funding body.

title.children: Two videos show how quickly things can change in our fragmented world

image.altText: A male and female couple in their late 40s smile at the camera in a selfie in front of a pool

props.synopsis: Craig and Lindsay Foreman were travelling through Iran on a world-wide trip when they were arrested.

title.children: British couple en route to Australia charged with espionage in Iran

image.altText: Haines in a white jacket speaks wearing glasses while Ryan listens next to her in a shiny teal jacket

props.synopsis: Crossbenchers including teal independents and the Greens say they will attempt to reform the federal corruption watchdog in the event of a hung parliament.

title.children: Crossbenchers push for NACC reforms after backflip on robodebt decision

image.altText: A hand is shown taking a test with pictures of Parliament House, the Australian Flag and a gavel in the background

props.synopsis: There's been a major decline in civics knowledge among school students, with many underperforming in their 2024 tests. Can you do any better?

title.children: Test your knowledge of civics to see if you can outperform a sixth grader

image.altText: A bright white circle, a black hole, surrounded by red accretion disc of hot gas and a flare.

props.synopsis: A black hole might conjure images of a dark, quiet void, but never-seen-before images captured by the James Webb Space Telescope reveals the centre of the Milky Way looks more like fireworks.

title.children: James Webb Space Telescope captures light show from Milky Way's black hole

image.altText: A window of a home damaged by a fire.

props.synopsis: Last year, Fire and Rescue NSW reported 323 fires ignited by lithium-ion batteries, an increase from 272 fires in 2023, and 165 fires in 2022.

title.children: Battery fires are increasing. Here's what causes the devices to ignite

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A woman holding a young baby in a crowd of people walking.

props.synopsis: Government troops clashed with their allied militias as they attempted to retreat from a key city, as a major rebel group continues its advance through the country's east.

title.children: UN condemns 'summary execution' of children by M23 rebels in Congo

image.altText: An aircraft identified by the Philippine Coast Guard as Chinese Navy helicopter flies close to a Philippines government  plane

props.synopsis: China has accused the Philippines of "spreading false narratives" after a second military incident with foreign aircraft over the South China Sea within a fortnight.Â

title.children: Chinese helicopter flies within 3m of Philippine plane in South China Sea

image.altText: A man dressed in a collared shirt holds a baby which has its face blurred.

props.synopsis: A Perth obstetrician tried to blame a rideshare driver for causing a crash that killed a 24-year-old woman, telling a court he had "only had two beers", despite recording a blood alcohol reading of 0.183 and travelling at 130kph in a 50kph zone, a court hears.

title.children: 'Why am I the bad guy?' Doctor tried to blame others for fatal crash, court told

image.altText: A group of people, including a journalist, unveiling a plaque

props.synopsis: The ABC's new office, based in the city's geographical centre, is officially open, with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Chair Kim Williams leading the ceremony.

title.children: ABC's new office in Sydney's west 'so important', says prime minister

image.altText: Group of men in a circle on Mudjimba beach

props.synopsis: Organisers say they are trying to promote wellness, peace, and connection within their communities through free activities. Then came the council bill.

title.children: Beach wellness gurus asked to pay up after anonymous complaints

image.altText: protesters in the Cook Islands

props.synopsis: Hundreds of protesters have taken to the streets in the Pacific nation of Cook Islands, urging the government to protect its ties with New Zealand.Â

title.children: Cook Islands PM facing no confidence vote over China pact

image.altText: New Royal Adelaide Hospital building site Feb 19, 2015

props.synopsis: Almost eight years after it opened, a public hospital once branded Australia's most-expensive building continues to cost taxpayers, with more than $20 million spent last financial year alone on a long-running legal battle between its builder and the South Australian Government.

title.children: Royal Adelaide Hospital legal battle leaves taxpayers with $20 million bill

image.altText: A bus lying on its roof, with wreckage all around it, at the bottom of a wide valley in the mountains.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating the cause of the crash, which happened on a bus route between two cities in the South American country.

title.children: At least 30 killed as bus plunges 800 metres off Bolivian cliff

image.altText: Mary holds the medal and looks down at it inside her house wearing a floral blouse and wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: For nearly three years Mary Goodger's parents hid a Jewish family behind a false wall in their house in the Netherlands. Eighty years after the liberation of Auschwitz she has a priceless medal that honours their efforts.

title.children: 'Mum never wanted to brag' about her courageous act during WWII

image.altText: Two women wearing blue and red Western Bulldogs AFLW kits smile at the camera with four people and city building behind them

props.synopsis: Sporting clubs like Chelsea have led the way on tailoring training to their players' menstrual cycles. But experts say the jury is still out on "phase based" interventions.

title.children: Menstrual cycle stigma continues to impact athletes, but one club is trying something new

image.altText: Anthony Albanese PM courtyard

props.synopsis: The man appointed by the Albanese government as special envoy to combat Islamophobia says authorities need to do more after two alleged attacks on Muslim women in Melbourne.

title.children: PM says 'racist' attacks must be punished after Muslim women targeted

image.altText: Shane Patton wears a navy blue police uniform and stands in front of green bushes.

title.children: The 'monumental' task awaiting Victoria's next top cop

image.altText: A baby lies in a medical cot connected to numerous tubes and machines as a person walks out of shot.

title.children: Specialist unit at Melbourne children's hospital runs out of funding

image.altText: a man in a hat looks out over blackened trees

props.synopsis: One family who lost everything in the February 2024 Pomonal fire says they wouldn't be rebuilding if it wasn't for their love of the community.

title.children: Residents near Grampians vow to stay after two bushfires in 12 months

image.altText: Michele Bullock seated at board table

props.synopsis: Rate cuts are like cockroaches: there's rarely just one. But the RBA board has warned households and financial markets not to expect an infestation.

title.children: Traders expect four rate cuts. The RBA boss reckons they're dreaming

image.altText: Woman holding document, while sitting at desk with computer on desk.

props.synopsis: A proposed shake-up of NSW abortion law would make it compulsory for most of the state's hospitals to offer the medical service.

title.children: Abortion law reform proposed in NSW after Orange hospital 'ban'

props.synopsis: A number of Muslim groups have signed an open letter condemning both the comments made by two Sydney nurses about treating Israeli patients, as well as the subsequent response.

title.children: Peak Muslim groups condemn 'selective outrage' over Sydney nurses
